Package ohos.ivihardware.cluster

Class ClusterManager

  • java.lang.Object
    • ohos.ivihardware.cluster.ClusterManager

  • public class ClusterManager
extends java.lang.Object
    A public class that obtains Cluster signal information.

    Cluster is short for electronic instrument cluster.

    This class provides basic Cluster signal identifiers, access types, and access methods. You can use the defined Cluster signal identifiers to obtain specified signal values.

    The vehicle Cluster domain mainly provides signals for Cluster system settings and in-vehicle infotainment settings.

    Since:
    3
    SystemCapability
    SystemCapability.Ivi.Cluster

      • getClusterSignal

        public static byte[] getClusterSignal​(java.lang.String propertyId,
                                      byte[] request)
                               throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException,
                                      ohos.rpc.RemoteException,
                                      java.lang.UnsupportedOperationException
        Obtains the Cluster signal value of the specified byte array type.

        You can obtain only the Cluster signal values that support query and subscription. The signal values are of the byte array type. You must use the data format defined by Protocol Buffers to serialize and deserialize the signal values.

        Sample code for obtaining a Cluster signal value: 

         byte[] request = { 'q', 'w' };
 try {
     byte[] signalValue = ClusterManager.getClusterSignal(ClusterManager.ID_CLUSTER_SETTINGS_BRIGHTNESS, request);
 } catch (RemoteException | IllegalArgumentException e) {
 };
        Parameters:
        propertyId - Identifies the Cluster signal, for example, ID_CLUSTER_SETTINGS_BRIGHTNESS.
        request - Indicates the request for the Cluster signal value in a byte array, which needs to be serialized based on the specified format.
        Returns:
        Returns the signal value in a byte array, which needs to be deserialized based on the specified format.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - Throws this exception if an input parameter is invalid, for example, if the input propertyId does not exist, cannot be obtained, or is null.
        ohos.rpc.RemoteException - Throws this exception if an IPC error occurs.
        java.lang.UnsupportedOperationException - Throws this exception if the signal is unavailable or the method is not supported.
        Since:
        3

      • setClusterActuator

        public static <T> void setClusterActuator​(java.lang.String clusterPropertyId,
                                          ClusterActuatorCallback callback,
                                          T value)
                                   throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException,
                                          ohos.rpc.RemoteException,
                                          java.lang.UnsupportedOperationException
        Obtains the Cluster signal value of a specified primitive data type.

        You can obtain the signal value of only the specified node type. The data type of the signal value can be int8, int, float, or string. You must use a variable whose data type is the same as that of the specified signal to save the result.

        Sample code for obtaining a Cluster signal value: 

         String clusterActuatorId = ClusterManager.ID_CLUSTER_SETTINGS_TIMEUNITID;
 Boolean value = true;
 ClusterActuatorCallback callback = new ClusterActuatorCallback() {
     @Override
     public void onErrorActuator(String propId, int errorCode) {
     }
 };
 try {
     ClusterManager.setClusterActuator(clusterActuatorId, callback, value);
 } catch (RemoteException | IllegalArgumentException e) {
 };
        Parameters:
        clusterPropertyId - Identifies the Cluster signal, for example, ID_CLUSTER_SETTINGS_TIMEUNIT.
        callback - Indicates the setting error callback.
        value - Indicates the signal value, which must be of a primitive data type.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - Throws this exception if an input parameter is invalid, for example, if the input propertyId does not exist, cannot be obtained, or is null.
        ohos.rpc.RemoteException - Throws this exception if an IPC error occurs.
        java.lang.UnsupportedOperationException - Throws this exception if the signal is unavailable or the method is not supported.
        Since:
        3

      • sendClusterSignal

        public static void sendClusterSignal​(java.lang.String clusterPropertyId,
                                     ClusterActuatorCallback callback,
                                     byte[] request)
                              throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException,
                                     ohos.rpc.RemoteException,
                                     java.lang.UnsupportedOperationException
        Sends the request for a Cluster signal of the specified byte array type.

        You can send requests for only Cluster signal values that support setting. The requested signal values are of the byte array type. You must use the data format defined by Protocol Buffers to serialize and deserialize the signal values.

        Sample code for sending the request for a Cluster signal: 

         String clusterActuatorId = ClusterManager.ID_CLUSTER_MUSIC_INFO;
 byte[] value = new byte[n];
 ClusterActuatorCallback callback = new ClusterActuatorCallback() {
     @Override
     public void onErrorActuator(String propId, int errorCode) {
     }
 };
 try {
     ClusterManager.sendClusterSignal(clusterActuatorId, callback, value);
 } catch (RemoteException | IllegalArgumentException e) {
 };
        Parameters:
        clusterPropertyId - Identifies the Cluster signal, for example, ID_CLUSTER_SETTINGS_TIMEUNIT. The node type must be actuator.
        callback - Indicates the setting error callback.
        request - Indicates the requested signal value in a byte array, which needs to be parsed based on the specified format.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - Throws this exception if an input parameter is invalid, for example, if the input propertyId does not exist, cannot be set, or is null.
        ohos.rpc.RemoteException - Throws this exception if an IPC error occurs.
        java.lang.UnsupportedOperationException - Throws this exception if the signal is unavailable or the method is not supported.
        Since:
        3

      • subscribeClusterSignal

        public static ClusterSubscription subscribeClusterSignal​(java.lang.String propertyid,
                                                         ClusterSignalCallback callback,
                                                         long interval)
                                                  throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException,
                                                         ohos.rpc.RemoteException,
                                                         java.lang.UnsupportedOperationException
        Subscribes to the specified Cluster signal value.

        You can obtain only the Cluster signal values that support query and subscription. The signal values are of the byte array type. You must use the data format defined by Protocol Buffers to parse the signal values.

        Sample code for subscribing to a Cluster signal value: 

         String clusterPropertyId = ClusterManager.ID_CLUSTER_SETTINGS_TIMEUNITID;
 long interval = 400;
 ClusterSignalCallbackImpl implements ClusterSignalCallback {
     @Override
     public void onChangeSignal(PropertyInfo propInfo) {
     }
     @Override
     public void onErrorSignal(String propId, int errorCode) {
     }
 }
 ClusterSignalCallbackImpl callback = new ClusterSignalCallbackImpl();
 try {
     ClusterManager.subscribeProperty(clusterPropertyId, callback, interval);
 } catch (RemoteException | IllegalArgumentException e) {
 };
        Parameters:
        propertyid - Identifies the Cluster signal to subscribe to.
        callback - Indicates the subscription callback.
        interval - Indicates the subscription period. For a periodic subscription, the value must be an integer multiple of 100 (minimum value: 100 ms). For an aperiodic subscription, the value must be Long.MAX_VALUE. Each signal value can be subscribed to either in periodic or aperiodic manner.
        Returns:
        Returns the subscription descriptor (used for unsubscription) if the subscription is successful.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - Throws this exception if an input parameter is invalid, for example, if the input clusterPropertyId does not exist or callback is null.
        ohos.rpc.RemoteException - Throws this exception if an IPC error occurs.
        java.lang.UnsupportedOperationException - Throws this exception if the signal is unavailable or the method is not supported.
        Since:
        3

      • subscribeBatchProperties

        public static java.util.Map<java.lang.String,ClusterSubscription> subscribeBatchProperties​(java.util.List<java.lang.String> propertyIds,
                                                                                           ClusterSignalCallback callback,
                                                                                           long interval)
        Subscribes to specified Cluster signal values in batches.

        This method is intended for Cluster signal values using the same subscription period and callback.

        Sample code for subscribing to Cluster signal values in batches: 

         List<String> propertyIds = new ArrayList<>();
 propertyIds.add(ClusterManager.ID_CLUSTER_SETTINGS_TIMEUNITID);
 propertyIds.add(ClusterManager.ID_CLUSTER_SETTINGS_TEMPUNITID);
 long interval = 400;
 ClusterSignalCallbackImpl implements ClusterSignalCallback {
     @Override
     public void onChangeSignal(PropertyInfo propInfo) {
     }
     @Override
     public void onErrorSignal(String propId, int errorCode) {
     }
 }
 ClusterSignalCallbackImpl callback = new ClusterSignalCallbackImpl();
 Map<String, ClusterSubscription> result = ClusterManager.subscribeBatchProperties(
 propertyIds, callback, interval)
        ;
        Parameters:
        propertyIds - Indicates the IDs of Cluster signal values to subscribe to.
        callback - Indicates the subscription callback.
        interval - Indicates the subscription period. For a periodic subscription, the value must be an integer multiple of 100 (minimum value: 100). For an aperiodic subscription, the value must be Long.MAX_VALUE. Each signal value can be subscribed to either in periodic or aperiodic manner.
        Returns:
        Returns a map of IDs and subscription descriptors of Cluster signal values.

        You can determine whether the subscription of a specified signal value is successful based on the return value, Specifically, the subscription succeeded if its descriptor is not null and failed if its descriptor is null.

        Since:
        3

      • unsubscribeClusterSignal

        public static void unsubscribeClusterSignal​(ClusterSubscription subscription)
                                     throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException,
                                            ohos.rpc.RemoteException,
                                            java.lang.UnsupportedOperationException
        Unsubscribes from the specified Cluster signal value.

        You must use the subscription descriptor returned by subscribeClusterSignal(java.lang.String, ohos.ivihardware.cluster.model.ClusterSignalCallback, long) as the value for the input parameter subscription.

        Sample code for unsubscribing from a Cluster signal value: 

         String clusterPropertyId = ClusterManager.ID_CLUSTER_SETTINGS_TIMEUNITID;
 long interval = 400;

 ClusterSignalCallbackImpl implements ClusterSignalCallback {
     @Override
     public void onChangeSignal(PropertyInfo propInfo) {
     }
     @Override
     public void onErrorSignal(String propId, int errorCode) {
     }
 }
 ClusterSignalCallbackImpl callback = new ClusterSignalCallbackImpl();
 ClusterSubscription subscription = null;
 try {
     subscription = ClusterManager.subscribeProperty(clusterPropertyId, callback, interval);
 } catch (RemoteException | IllegalArgumentException e) {
 };
 try {
     ClusterManager.unsubscribeProperty(subscription);
 } catch (RemoteException | IllegalArgumentException e) {
 }
        ;
        Parameters:
        subscription - Identifies the successful subscription.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - Throws this exception if the input parameter is invalid, for example, if the input subscription is null.
        ohos.rpc.RemoteException - Throws this exception if an IPC error occurs.
        java.lang.UnsupportedOperationException - Throws this exception if the signal is unavailable or the method is not supported.
        Since:
        3

      • unsubscribeClusterSignalAll

        public static void unsubscribeClusterSignalAll​()
                                        throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException,
                                               ohos.rpc.RemoteException,
                                               java.lang.UnsupportedOperationException
        Unsubscribes from all Cluster signal values that your application has subscribed to.

        Sample code for unsubscribing from all Cluster signal values: 

         try {
     ClusterManager.unsubscribeAllProperty();
 } catch (RemoteException | IllegalArgumentException e) {
 }
        ;
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - Throws this exception if an error occurs at the service layer.
        ohos.rpc.RemoteException - Throws this exception if an IPC error occurs.
        java.lang.UnsupportedOperationException - Throws this exception if the signal is unavailable or the method is not supported.
        Since:
        3
